items.name: `array.shift()` (as introduced in ES3)
items.description: The `shift()` function removes the first element of an array and returns it.

links.comment: Very well readable, easy to understand description of how shift() works.
The version of the specification where `array.shift()` was introduced (PDF 723kB).

items.name: `array.push()` (as introduced in ES3)
items.description: The `push()` function adds one or more elements to the end of an array.

links.comment: Very well readable, easy to understand description of how push() works.
The version of the specification where `array.push()` was introduced, see section 15.4.4.7. (PDF 723kB)
